creator: Maclean, John, 1851-1928. (author)
description: Maclean, John: 1851-1928. Methodist missionary and author; served as Chief Archivist of the Methodist Church of Canada; worked among Blood Indians, near Fort Macleod, 1880-1889; stationed at Moose Jaw, 1889-1892; at various churches in Manitoba, 1895-1928; during his stay in Northwest Territories, served as school inspector and on Board of Education (Morgan, Canadian men and women of the time, 1912; United Church of Canada. Yearbook, 1930). // On title-page: "Reprinted from the Barrie Examiner. " Text in double columns. Biography of Rev. George Millward McDougall and his mission in Alberta.
publisher: Barrie Examiner Printing & Publishing House (Barrie, Ont.)
subject: The Spiritual Life--Methodist Church
